snippet: Voters softened a law imposing a life sentence for any felony conviction if a defendant had two prior serious convictions.
abstract: Editorial applauds California voters who approved ballot initiative revising infamous three-strikes law of 1994, which imposed life sentence for defendants with three felony convictions; says revised law, which was long in coming, is vast improvement on measure that was financially burdensome and grossly unfair.
lead_paragraph: Voters softened a law imposing a life sentence for any felony conviction if a defendant had two prior serious convictions.

headline.seo: A Three-Strikes Law Made Fairer in California
